titleStmt.title: Wesley Burnett to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5841

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To the Honorable Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

Your petition Wesley Burnett of Trimble county Kentucky would most respectfully represent, that at the May term of the Trimble circuit court he was fined the sum of Twenty five ^Dollars^ for betting a treat on a game at cards, He says he and his friends were amusing themselves as he thought and Some person present reported that they were betting money, which was not the case, He therefore prays your honor to remit said fine as he is a very poor man, and is not in the habit of gambling

And as in duty bound will ever pray &,c, &,c,
Sept 16. 1864 -- Wesley Burnett
We the undersigned citizens of Trimble county Ky join the petition in his prayer &c. &c.

S. Gatewood
D R Lune
J. S. Ladd
Y. B. Hunt
S. G. Peck
W. Stratton
Jacob Downs
J B Pierce
T. B. Gatewood
Union
men
F. A. Adams
Whitfield Singer
J. W. Stewart
Stephen T Yeager
G. W. Arington
T M McCarty
B C Yeager
Fleming Yeager
A J Bartlett
Joseph straton
G. W. Perkinson
James Cimalena
J. G Chalford
J T Shipherd
B M Hunter
D, B, Johnson
